meanings.definition: To descend from an aircraft using a parachute.
meanings.sent1: She parachuted from the plane and floated gently to the ground.
meanings.sent2: The skydiver parachuted safely to the earth below.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous squirrel decided to parachute from the tree to the grass.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams parachuted down to reality as she landed softly on the field.
meanings.sent5: The colorful parachute billowed as she parachuted down, creating a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: To drop or land by parachute.
meanings.sent1: The supplies parachuted down to the troops in need.
meanings.sent2: The care package parachuted into the disaster-stricken area.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat managed to parachute a toy mouse from the shelf.
meanings.sent4: The idea parachuted into his mind, suddenly and unexpectedly.
meanings.sent5: The golden leaves parachuted gracefully from the tree, painting the ground in autumn colors.
